intro: Crotalaria triphylla, commonly known as the three-leaf crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces bright yellow flowers in racemes, which are followed by distinctive bean-like pods containing several seeds. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and has the ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen through its root nodules. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
